channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Felt like a kidnapping': Wrong turn leads to 5-day detention ordeal
item.description: A Guatemalan immigrant without legal status says she took a wrong turn on a highway near the Canadian border and was detained with her two children, w...

item.title: Colorado is poised to pass some of the toughest gun laws in the country
item.description: A proposal to severely limit guns that use detachable magazines is approaching final passage in the Colorado legislature. The state's Democratic gover...

item.title: Buying or selling on StubHub? It's probably not showing you all the available tickets
item.description: StubHub has a "Recommended Tickets" filter that only displays some tickets but not others. It's automatically turned on — and it's upsetting users.

item.title: Dems want to investigate Signal blunder. And, federal return-to-office complications
item.description: Top Democrats call for an investigation into how war plans were shared with a journalist on Signal. And, federal employees face complications and shor...

item.title: Why don't diving seals drown? Scientists finally have an answer
item.description: New research suggests seals sense internal oxygen levels to know when to come up for air. Digital version of story that already aired. Skedded for pub...

item.title: Flight data show Steve Witkoff was in Russia during group chat on Signal
item.description: As top Trump Cabinet members sent texts in a Signal group chat, CBS News analysis shows one of them, Steve Witkoff, was in Russia.

item.title: Sudan army accused of killing hundreds in airstrike on Darfur market
item.description: Videos posted on social media show the smoking ruins of market stalls and charred bodies.

item.title: At least 24 dead in South Korea's 'worst ever fires'
item.description: The wildfires are threatening cultural sites and "rewriting the record books", according to authorities.

item.title: A year after the Baltimore bridge collapse, a long road to recovery is ahead
item.description: A year after the catastrophic collapse of Baltimore’s Francis Scott Key Bridge, Maryland leaders are honoring the six construction workers killed that...

item.title: Stephen Smith: A Death in Murdaugh Country
item.description: New evidence discovered after Murdaugh murders reignites a cold case. "48 Hours" obtains findings of independent forensic experts. CBS News national c...

item.title: 3/25: CBS Evening News
item.description: Trump defends security team after Yemen chat leak; This week in nature: a new Yellowstone vent, a star is born and the rescue of a dozen chicks

item.title: Russia says sanctions must be lifted before Ukraine maritime ceasefire can start
item.description: Moscow and Kyiv appear at odds over when and how the US-brokered deal will come into effect.

item.title: 3/25: The Daily Report
item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on the fallout from a Trump Administration group chat, potential cybersecurity concerns surrounding Signal, and tariffs on coun...

item.title: The row that rocked K-pop: NewJeans on courage of speaking out
item.description: NewJeans talk to the BBC in their first interview since a court blocked their attempt to leave their record label.

item.title: 3/25: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: Senators grill intelligence officials over leaked Houthi strike group chat; Reporter's Notebook: When convenience becomes a security risk

item.title: Mike Waltz takes 'full responsibility' for Signal group chat leak
item.description: But the US national security adviser said he could not explain how a journalist was added to a chat discussing air strikes in Yemen.

item.title: Gunman who killed 23 in racist attack at Texas Walmart is offered plea deal to avoid death penalty
Pilot and 2 young daughters survive the night on airplane wing after crashing into icy Alaska lake
